text:
are you using docker or kubernetes?

either way, you should need to setup and authenticator provider, such as Auth0

as for other wallet providers, there are some 3rd parties that can do it - currently Copper and DFNS provide external Canton Coin wallets

text:
Hi Team, we are testing restore of the validator node using the Node Identities backup. We are doing this
<https://docs.dev.sync.global/validator_operator/validator_disaster_recovery.html#re-onboard-a-validator-and-recover-balances-of-all-users-it-hosts>

We have created the secret with dump file and also modified *`standalone-validator-values.yaml`* according to the document.
<https://docs.dev.sync.global/validator_operator/validator_disaster_recovery.html#kubernetes-deployment>

But while changing *`standalone-validator-values.yaml`*, as per the document, we need to change the *`newParticipantIdentifier`* to a new value and it should be the same for *`nodeIdentifier`*  but nothing was mentioned to change *`validatorPartyHint`* .

In our old configuration we gave *`validatorPartyHint`*  and *`nodeIdentifier`*  same values. I'm not sure for restore if we need *`validatorPartyHint`* at all. And if we need it incase, any idea if we need to keep *`validatorPartyHint`* as the original value or the new value that matches *`newParticipantIdentifier`*.

elements.text: This was created for super-validator long time ago but not many things changed since then and it can be reworked for validator by removing unnecessary parts

text:
I used this, but I removed the k8s ingress and keycloak "infra deploy" (statefulset/svc/etc..) pieces so I could use the bitnami helm chart to deploy keycloak (and use custom ingress, pvc and such) -- this way I can just point it to the keycloak API and bootstrap the keycloak realm. The thing that threw me for a bit of a loop is setting up the k8s secret for `splice-app-validator-ledger-api-auth` -- the docs use `VALIDATOR_CLIENT_ID` for both `ledger-api-user=` and `client-id=` however in keycloak I seem to need to let it fail, generate the service account UUID, then use the service ID for `ledger-api-user` IE `"--from-literal=ledger-api-user=${VALIDATOR_SVC_UUID}" \`
it would be nice to get a deploy-agnostic keycloak realm config using terraform in source control, and to be able to explain the secret config in the docs

elements.text: I used this, but I removed the k8s ingress and keycloak "infra deploy" (statefulset/svc/etc..) pieces so I could use the bitnami helm chart to deploy keycloak (and use custom ingress, pvc and such) -- this way I can just point it to the keycloak API and bootstrap the keycloak realm. The thing that threw me for a bit of a loop is setting up the k8s secret for

it would be nice to get a deploy-agnostic keycloak realm config using terraform in source control, and to be able to explain the secret config in the docs

text:
The sample in the archive was supposed to serve the perpose of a reference of a working setup only, not something to be reused as is but rather run, explore, study and create your own. I agree that having a working configuration as a part of the upstream source would be helpful. If splice folks are ready to support this we can createball necessary parts and submit a PR. However I'm not sure they would as they don't use terraform themselves.

<@U03HMUTQ5F0> <@U03QSP8LP9T> what's your take on this?

elements.text: The sample in the archive was supposed to serve the perpose of a reference of a working setup only, not something to be reused as is but rather run, explore, study and create your own. I agree that having a working configuration as a part of the upstream source would be helpful. If splice folks are ready to support this we can createball necessary parts and submit a PR. However I'm not sure they would as they don't use terraform themselves.

text: Keycloak in this case would come in a form of a Helm-chart and Realm configuration would be done by terraform. The order of setting up a validator would become: db server -> keycloak helm chart -> realm configuration (by terraform) -> the rest -> (participant and validator)

elements.text: Keycloak in this case would come in a form of a Helm-chart and Realm configuration would be done by terraform. The order of setting up a validator would become: db server -> keycloak helm chart -> realm configuration (by terraform) -> the rest -> (participant and validator)
